text: good morning from the Seychelles
[Music]
it's just a three-hour flight to get
here from Mauritius so I couldn't pass
up the opportunity to visit a new
country I ended up coming here
spontaneously buying a last-minute
flight and booking my hotel this morning
at the airport but these usually end up
being the best kind of adventures so
what can you do and see in the
Seychelles besides ironically lots of
seashells it's time to find out and I
have absolutely no plans or contact in
this archipelago of 120 plus islands I
quickly found out that the Seychelles is
not a cheap destinations by any means
but if you live like a local then you
can find some good deals the capital of
Victoria on Maha island where M now has
nearly 25 thousand people making it the
smallest capital in Africa and one of
the smallest in the world there are a
few traffic lights scattered shops and
restaurants and you can explore the
entire town on foot in about an hour
unfortunately I found out the truth
about legality what's a holiday
Constitution meaning 95 percent of shops
are closed not a lot going on so I
slightly dug myself into a hole
but regardless today I'm gonna take you
around the Seychelles to see how much I
can get for $10 first things first the
beach it's the pride and joy of the
Seychelles I hopped in a local bus and
got off at a beach club both alone and
wow this place is stunning whenever
you're on an island as tropical as the
Seychelles you are bound to find some
coconuts I stumbled upon this street
stall the only thing open and I got
myself a nice coconut it's not bad but
for 30 rupees I think I got ripped off
[Music]
I hopped on another bus back to Victoria
to see what's happening which wasn't
much at all I'm getting pretty hungry
and after all what would a ten dollar
video be without food I want to try the
local cuisine but no restaurants are
open so I have to settle upon a small
shop which is owned by a friendly Indian
guy let's go to my shop okay one of
those and then one samosa crispy tasty
in here Jenny be brutal snacks samosa
this is what
wada say Bru okay how much 30 rupees
these vada things are delicious and the
say brew has like a Bud Light the next
shop over has more local snacks so why
not give it a try since I'm out of
options but on that kick a banana cake
okay he's good mmm banana cakes good not
bad I aimlessly wandered around Victoria
for another hour looked at some
monuments and then walked back to my
hotel the Sri Lankan guy working here
offered to make chicken curry if I
bought some extra ingredients so I went
to the local shop and I did curry powder
tomatoes cucumbers and water for better
or for worse this was the highlight of
my day in the Seychelles both both Sri
Lankan food in total I got two bus rides
one coconut one samosa one vada once a
brew beer one banana cake and one
chicken curry dinner for $9.88 hey guys
I apologize this video was quite slow
truth is everything is closed in
Victoria and the things that are open
are really expensive so thanks for
watching anyways and I'm just gonna go
spend the rest of the day at the beach
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
